cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves happen every year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The 2nd ranked rain rate was recorded today with a peak rate of 16.6mm per hour, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  5.69mm of rain fell during the storm's 3.2 hours length.  The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

storm.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.
There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 26 August 2025, is ranked 4th among the longest rainy periods since August 2024.  It has lasted 10 days so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (197°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 65.28 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.9°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar) and rainfall (up 1.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.2 mm), cloud levels (up 1106 m), feels like temperature (up 2.8°C), and outside temperature (up 2.3°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 380.8m higher than yesterday, 11.9m lower than the past week, 1106.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 565m minimum and 1838m maximum, with an average of 1491.3m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1503.3m and 2600m.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and little or no wind. Moderate rainfall, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and very bright daylight. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
